channel.title: How do people log in my server ( no-ip )
channel.description:
:( ok people, first of all i have to tell you that im not putting my server on the site... its testscape! ok lets get started. i want people to join my server but i dont know what to tell them to write in server ip!!! For the no-ip duc i put my servers ip: lallzscape.no-ip.org, and when they try it, it dose not [glow=red,2,300]WORK![/glow] :confused: :confused: :confused: what do they have to do to possibly log in my server!!!!! :):):):):):) Thanks
Killer
PS: I DID THE PORT FORWARDING[br][size=1]Posted at: November 26, 2006, 04:29:54 PM[/size][hr]im giving rep++ for this !!! answer good !!!

item.source: How do people log in my server ( no-ip )

item.title: How do people log in my server ( no-ip )
item.dc:creator: @bmxscape bmxscape
item.description:
@bmxscape wrote:

Purpose: 3 TUTs in 1: getting a No-IP account, getting your Static IP set and Portforward your router.

Difficulty: 3-4/10

Assumed Knowledge: reading a TUT and setting the right things.

Server Base: ANY.

Classes Modified: NONE.

NO-IP part.

How to:

Part 1: Getting your account

  1. Open ur browser (ANY)
  2. Go to NO-IP.com (direct link: www.no-ip.com)
  3. U will see something like this at the top:

Email: LOGIN Lost Password?
Password: Sign-up Now!

3b. Click: “Sign-up Now!”
4. Fill in all required fields and follow the instructions on your screen.
5. Now it’s time to log in!!! LOG IN.
6a. You will see: “Hosts/Redirect” Click it.
6b. Then click “add”
6c. you will see an upper part and a part under it. ONLY fill in the upper part: “Hostname information”
6d. fill in all required fields. at “Host type”, choose: “DNS Host (A)”
6e. DON’T TOUCH THE IP ADDRESS ZONE, normally it’s already filled in. If not, refresh ur page!!!
6f. Click: “Create Host”
7. Grats if succeeded (if not restart this from 1.)

Part 2: Downloading the No-IP DUC:

  1. On the top u got to see: “downloads”. Click it.
  2. Now select your operation system.
  3. Click the download link. You will come onto another page.
  4. Click: “Download now”
  5. If the program is finally downloaded, run it, fill in your Email and Password and u will see your No-IP (like: tryitoutscape.no-ip.org). activate it.
  6. Grats if succeeded (if not restart this from 1.)

Credits: 100% to ME

Purpose: 3 TUTs in 1: getting a No-IP account, getting your Static IP set and Portforward your router.

Difficulty: 3-4/10

Assumed Knowledge: reading a TUT and setting the right things.

Server Base: ANY.

Classes Modified: NONE.

Static-IP part.

How to:

Setting up a static ip for Windows XP:

Step 1:
Open up the start menu, and click Run.

Step 2:
Type ‘cmd’ in the “Run program”, and click Okay. That will bring up a black command prompt window.

Step 3:
Type “ipconfig/all” in that window, and then press the enter key. This will display a lot of information. Enlarge the window.

Step 4:
I want you to write down some of the information in this window. Write down the IP address, Subnet Mask, Default Gateway, and Name Servers. Name Server is just another name for DNS(domain name server) server. Make sure to note which is which. We are going to use this information a little bit later.

Step 5:
Once again open the start menu. This time click Control Panel. If u didn’t wrote down the information, then don’t close your “Run program”

Step 6:
Double click Network Connections.

Step 7:
You may have several network connections in this window. I want you to right click on the one you use to connect to the internet. Then click properties.

If you are unsure of which one that is, right click it and then click disable. Open a new copy of your web browser. Did it open a webpage? If you can not, then you’ve found your internet connection. Close that browser window. Go ahead and right click the network connection again and then click enable. Once again open up a new web browser. You should see a webpage. Close the browser window. Right click on the network connection and click properties at the bottom.

Step 8:
Click the properties button to open up the properties window of this internet connection.

Step 9:
Click Internet Protocol(TCP/IP) and then the Properties button.

Step 10:
Before you make any changes, write down the settings that you see on this page. If something goes wrong you can always change the settings back to what they were! You should see a dot in the Obtain an IP address automatically box. If you do not, your connection is already setup for a static ip. Just close all these windows and you are done.

Click “Use the following IP Address”. Then enter the ip address we previously found in the “Run program”, then put the subnet mask, The default gateway and Enter the DNS servers. Click okay all the way out of this menu. You are done.

For every detail go to www.portforward.com and then to the static IP help. (Or a direct link: http://www.portforward.com/networking/static-xp.htm)

VERY IMPORTANT NOTE (!!!): THIS WILL ONLY WORK FOR WINDOWS XP!!!

For all other operation systems:

-Windows ME===========>http://www.portforward.com/networking/static-me.htm
-Windows 2k or 2000=====>http://www.portforward.com/networking/static-2k.htm
-Windows 98===========>http://www.portforward.com/networking/static-98.htm
-Mac OS X v10.4========>http://www.portforward.com/networking/static-Mac10.4.htm

~~~~GRATS IF SUCCEEDED ~~~~
